text:
November 5, 1956
Mss Anna L. Hyer
Associate Executive Secretary-
Department of Audio-Visual Instruction
National Education Association
1201 Sixteenth Street, Northwest
Washington 6, D. C*
Dear Ann:
No objection to any of the programs you list in your October 31 letter. I hope
you eventually get many more.
I hope Bob has by now sent you brochures (and mentions of albums) for Jeffersonian
Heritage and 'Nays of Mankind I. Did you decide against Ways of Mankind II? The
FAE found the second series the most useful of the two, and brought out special
discussion group albums entitled Ways of Justice, for this.
See you in Atlantic City, I trust.
Sincerely,
HJSjdfc
Harry J. Skomia
Executive Director
